StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SignForm]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @PackageId uniqueiden..er, @FriendlyName varchar(50), @Data image, @Username varchar(50) ) AS
BEGIN TRANSACTION
DECLARE @FormId uniqueiden..er
--Get the FormId for the form we're signing. SET @FormId = (SELECT TOP(1) FormId from [AFP].[USMC].[Form] WHERE PersonId = @PackageId AND FriendlyName = @FriendlyName ORDER BY DateUploaded DESC)
-- Before upda.ng, archive the old record if IsValidated or IsSigned
DELETE FROM [AFP].[USMC].[WorkingFileArchive] WHERE FormId = @FormId AND IsSigned = 1 AND IsValidated = 1
INSERT INTO [AFP].[USMC].[WorkingFileArchive] SELECT newID(),* FROM [AFP].[USMC].[Form] WHERE FormId = @FormId AND (IsValidated = 1 AND IsSigned = 1)
--Update the form data and set it to Signed. UPDATE [USMC].[FORM] SET Data = @Data, IsSigned = 1 WHERE FormId = @FormId
--Insert a record into the form history for this form. INSERT INTO [AFP].[USMC].[FormHistory] ([FormHistoryId], [FormId], [Ac.on], [Ac.onDate], [Actor]) VALUES (newId(), @FormId, 'Signed', GetDate(), @Username)
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION -- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully, commit the transac.on COMMIT TRANSACTION
